name: CKEDITOR
doc: This is the API entry point. The entire CKEditor code runs under this object.

members.name: disableAutoInline
members.doc:
Disables creating the inline editor automatically for elements with contenteditable attribute set to the true.

CKEDITOR.disableAutoInline = true;
members.short_doc:
Disables creating the inline editor automatically for elements with
contenteditable attribute set to the true. ...

members.name: replaceClass
members.doc:
The class name used to identify <textarea> elements to be replaced by CKEditor instances. Set it to empty/null to disable this feature.

CKEDITOR.replaceClass = 'rich_editor';
members.short_doc:
The class name used to identify <textarea> elements to be replaced
by CKEditor instances. ...

members.name: skinName
members.doc:
The skin to load for all created instances, it may be the name of the skin folder inside the editor installation path, or the name and the path separated by a comma.

Note: This is a global configuration that applies to all instances.

CKEDITOR.skinName = 'moono';

CKEDITOR.skinName = 'myskin,/customstuff/myskin/';
members.short_doc:
The skin to load for all created instances, it may be the name of the skin
folder inside the editor installation path...

members.name: CTRL
members.doc: CTRL key (0x110000).

members.name: DIALOG_RESIZE_BOTH
members.doc: Allow the dialog to be resized in both directions.
members.short_doc: Allow the dialog to be resized in both directions. ...

members.name: DIALOG_RESIZE_HEIGHT
members.doc: Only allow vertical resizing for this dialog, disable horizontal resizing.
members.short_doc: Only allow vertical resizing for this dialog, disable horizontal resizing. ...

members.name: DIALOG_RESIZE_NONE
members.doc: No resize for this dialog.
members.short_doc: No resize for this dialog. ...

members.name: DIALOG_RESIZE_WIDTH
members.doc: Only allow horizontal resizing for this dialog, disable vertical resizing.
members.short_doc: Only allow horizontal resizing for this dialog, disable vertical resizing. ...

members.name: ELEMENT_MODE_APPENDTO
members.doc: The editor is to be created inside the element.
members.short_doc: The editor is to be created inside the element. ...

members.name: ELEMENT_MODE_INLINE
members.doc: The editor is to be attached to the element, using it as the editing block.
members.short_doc: The editor is to be attached to the element, using it as the editing block. ...

members.name: ELEMENT_MODE_NONE
members.doc: The editor has no associated element.
members.short_doc: The editor has no associated element. ...

members.name: ELEMENT_MODE_REPLACE
members.doc: The element is to be replaced by the editor instance.
members.short_doc: The element is to be replaced by the editor instance. ...

members.name: END
members.doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.checkBoundaryOfElement.
members.short_doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.checkBoundaryOfElement. ...

members.doc: Used in conjunction with CKEDITOR.config.enterMode and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode configuration settings to make the editor produce <br> tags when using the Enter key.
members.short_doc:
Used in conjunction with CKEDITOR.config.enterMode
and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode configuration
settings to make ...

members.short_doc:
Used in conjunction with CKEDITOR.config.enterMode
and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode configuration
settings to make ...

members.doc: Used in conjunction with CKEDITOR.config.enterMode and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode configuration settings to make the editor produce <p> tags when using the Enter key.
members.short_doc:
Used in conjunction with CKEDITOR.config.enterMode
and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode configuration
settings to make ...

members.doc: Event at target.
members.short_doc: Event at target. ...

members.doc: Bubbling phase.
members.short_doc: Bubbling phase. ...

members.name: EVENT_PHASE_CAPTURING

members.name: FILTER_SKIP_TREE
members.doc:
A flag indicating that the current element and all its ancestors should not be filtered.

See CKEDITOR.filter.addElementCallback for more details.
members.short_doc:
A flag indicating that the current element and all its ancestors
should not be filtered. ...

members.name: LINEUTILS_AFTER
members.doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (after).
members.short_doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (after). ...

members.name: LINEUTILS_BEFORE
members.doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (before).
members.short_doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (before). ...

members.name: LINEUTILS_INSIDE
members.doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (inside).
members.short_doc: Determines a position relative to an element in DOM (inside). ...

members.name: NODE_COMMENT
members.doc: Comment node type.
members.short_doc: Comment node type. ...

members.name: NODE_DOCUMENT
members.doc: Document node type.
members.short_doc: Document node type. ...

members.name: NODE_DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT
members.doc: Document fragment node type.
members.short_doc: Document fragment node type. ...

members.name: NODE_ELEMENT
members.doc: Element node type.
members.short_doc: Element node type. ...

members.name: NODE_TEXT
members.doc: Text node type.
members.short_doc: Text node type. ...

members.name: POSITION_AFTER_END
members.doc:
Indicates a position after end of a node.

// When used according to an element:
// <element>contents</element>^ (range is anchored in element's parent)

// When used according to a text node:
// "text"^ (range is anchored in text node's parent)

It is used as a parameter of methods like: CKEDITOR.dom.range.moveToPosition, CKEDITOR.dom.range.setStartAt and CKEDITOR.dom.range.setEndAt.
members.short_doc: Indicates a position after end of a node. ...

members.name: POSITION_AFTER_START
members.doc:
Indicates a position after start of a node.

// When used according to an element:
// <element>^contents</element>

// When used according to a text node:
// "^text" (range is anchored in the text node)

It is used as a parameter of methods like: CKEDITOR.dom.range.moveToPosition, CKEDITOR.dom.range.setStartAt and CKEDITOR.dom.range.setEndAt.
members.short_doc: Indicates a position after start of a node. ...

members.name: POSITION_BEFORE_END
members.doc:
Indicates a position before end of a node.

// When used according to an element:
// <element>contents^</element>

// When used according to a text node:
// "text^" (range is anchored in the text node)

It is used as a parameter of methods like: CKEDITOR.dom.range.moveToPosition, CKEDITOR.dom.range.setStartAt and CKEDITOR.dom.range.setEndAt.
members.short_doc: Indicates a position before end of a node. ...

members.name: POSITION_BEFORE_START
members.doc:
Indicates a position before start of a node.

// When used according to an element:
// ^<element>contents</element> (range is anchored in element's parent)

// When used according to a text node:
// ^"text" (range is anchored in text node's parent)

It is used as a parameter of methods like: CKEDITOR.dom.range.moveToPosition, CKEDITOR.dom.range.setStartAt and CKEDITOR.dom.range.setEndAt.
members.short_doc: Indicates a position before start of a node. ...

members.name: SELECTION_ELEMENT
members.doc:
Element selection.

if ( editor.getSelection().getType() == CKEDITOR.SELECTION_ELEMENT )
    alert( 'An element is selected' );
members.short_doc: Element selection. ...

members.name: SELECTION_NONE
members.doc:
No selection.

if ( editor.getSelection().getType() == CKEDITOR.SELECTION_NONE )
    alert( 'Nothing is selected' );
members.short_doc: No selection. ...

members.name: SELECTION_TEXT
members.doc:
A text or a collapsed selection.

if ( editor.getSelection().getType() == CKEDITOR.SELECTION_TEXT )
    alert( 'A text is selected' );
members.short_doc: A text or a collapsed selection. ...

members.name: SHIFT
members.doc: SHIFT key (0x220000).
members.short_doc: SHIFT key (0x220000). ...

members.short_doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.shrink. ...

members.doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.shrink.
members.short_doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.shrink. ...

members.doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.checkBoundaryOfElement.
members.short_doc: See CKEDITOR.dom.range.checkBoundaryOfElement. ...

members.doc:
Block style type.

Read more in the CKEDITOR.style class documentation.
members.short_doc: Block style type. ...

members.name: STYLE_INLINE
members.doc:
Inline style type.

Read more in the CKEDITOR.style class documentation.
members.short_doc: Inline style type. ...

members.name: STYLE_OBJECT
members.doc:
Object style type.

Read more in the CKEDITOR.style class documentation.

members.name: TRISTATE_DISABLED
members.doc: Used to indicate the DISABLED state.
members.short_doc: Used to indicate the DISABLED state. ...

members.name: TRISTATE_OFF
members.doc: Used to indicate the OFF or INACTIVE state.
members.short_doc: Used to indicate the OFF or INACTIVE state. ...

members.name: TRISTATE_ON
members.doc: Used to indicate the ON or ACTIVE state.
members.short_doc: Used to indicate the ON or ACTIVE state. ...

members.name: UI_BUTTON
members.doc: Button UI element.
members.short_doc: Button UI element. ...

members.doc: Button UI element.
members.short_doc: Button UI element. ...

members.doc: Panel UI element.
members.short_doc: Panel UI element. ...

members.doc: Button UI element.
members.short_doc: Button UI element. ...

members.doc: Button UI element.
members.short_doc: Button UI element. ...

members.name: UI_SEPARATOR
members.doc: Separator UI element.
members.short_doc: Separator UI element. ...

members.doc: Private object used to hold core stuff. It should not be used outside of the API code as properties defined here may change at any time without notice.
members.short_doc: Private object used to hold core stuff. ...

members.name: basePath
members.doc:
The full URL for the CKEditor installation directory. It is possible to manually provide the base path by setting a global variable named CKEDITOR_BASEPATH. This global variable must be set before the editor script loading.

alert( CKEDITOR.basePath ); // e.g. 'http://www.example.com/ckeditor/'
members.short_doc: The full URL for the CKEditor installation directory. ...

members.name: currentInstance
members.doc:
The editor which is currently active (has user focus).

function showCurrentEditorName() {
    if ( CKEDITOR.currentInstance )
        alert( CKEDITOR.currentInstance.name );
    else
        alert( 'Please focus an editor first.' );
}@see CKEDITOR#event-currentInstance
members.short_doc: The editor which is currently active (has user focus). ...

members.name: document
members.doc:
The document of the window storing the CKEDITOR object.

alert( CKEDITOR.document.getBody().getName() ); // 'body'
members.short_doc: The document of the window storing the CKEDITOR object. ...

members.name: instances
members.doc:
Stores references to all editor instances created. The name of the properties in this object correspond to instance names, and their values contain the CKEDITOR.editor object representing them.

alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.name ); // 'editor1'
members.short_doc: Stores references to all editor instances created. ...

members.name: loadFullCoreTimeout
members.doc:
The time to wait (in seconds) to load the full editor code after the page load, if the "ckeditor_basic" file is used. If set to zero, the editor is loaded on demand, as soon as an instance is created.

This value must be set on the page before the page load completion.

// Loads the full source after five seconds.
CKEDITOR.loadFullCoreTimeout = 5;
members.short_doc:
The time to wait (in seconds) to load the full editor code after the
page load, if the "ckeditor_basic" file is used. ...

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Contains the CKEditor revision number. The revision number is incremented automatically, following each modification to the CKEditor source code.

alert( CKEDITOR.revision ); // e.g. '3975'
members.short_doc: Contains the CKEditor revision number. ...

members.name: rnd
members.doc:
A 3-digit random integer, valid for the entire life of the CKEDITOR object.

alert( CKEDITOR.rnd ); // e.g. 319
members.short_doc: A 3-digit random integer, valid for the entire life of the CKEDITOR object. ...

members.name: status
members.doc:
Indicates the API loading status. The following statuses are available:

  • unloaded: the API is not yet loaded.
  • basic_loaded: the basic API features are available.
  • basic_ready: the basic API is ready to load the full core code.
  • loaded: the API can be fully used.

Example:

if ( CKEDITOR.status == 'loaded' ) {
    // The API can now be fully used.
    doSomething();
} else {
    // Wait for the full core to be loaded and fire its loading.
    CKEDITOR.on( 'load', doSomething );
    CKEDITOR.loadFullCore && CKEDITOR.loadFullCore();
}
members.short_doc: Indicates the API loading status. ...

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
A constant string unique for each release of CKEditor. Its value is used, by default, to build the URL for all resources loaded by the editor code, guaranteeing clean cache results when upgrading.

alert( CKEDITOR.timestamp ); // e.g. '87dm'
members.short_doc: A constant string unique for each release of CKEditor. ...

members.name: version
members.doc:
Contains the CKEditor version number.

alert( CKEDITOR.version ); // e.g. 'CKEditor 3.4.1'
members.short_doc: Contains the CKEditor version number. ...

members.name: add
members.doc: Adds an editor instance to the global CKEDITOR object. This function is available for internal use mainly.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to be added.

members.short_doc: Adds an editor instance to the global CKEDITOR object. ...

members.name: addCss
members.doc:
Adds CSS rules to be appended to the editor document. This method is mostly used by plugins to add custom styles to the editor document. For basic content styling the contents.css file should be used instead.

Note: This function should be called before the creation of editor instances.

// Add styles for all headings inside editable contents.
CKEDITOR.addCss( '.cke_editable h1,.cke_editable h2,.cke_editable h3 { border-bottom: 1px dotted red }' );

params.name: css
params.doc: The style rules to be appended. @see CKEDITOR.config.contentsCss

members.short_doc: Adds CSS rules to be appended to the editor document. ...

members.name: addTemplate
members.doc: Adds a named CKEDITOR.template instance to be reused among all editors. This will return the existing one if a template with same name is already defined. Additionally, it fires the "template" event to allow template source customization.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name which identifies a UI template.

params.name: source
params.doc: The source string for constructing this template.

members.short_doc: Adds a named CKEDITOR.template instance to be reused among all editors. ...

members.name: appendTo
members.doc:
Creates a new editor instance at the end of a specific DOM element.

<div id="editorSpace"></div>
...
CKEDITOR.appendTo( 'editorSpace' );

params.name: element
params.doc: The DOM element, its ID, or name.

params.name: config
params.doc: The specific configuration to apply to this editor instance. Configuration set here will override the global CKEditor settings (see CKEDITOR.config).

params.name: data
params.doc: Since 3.3. Initial value for the instance.

members.short_doc: Creates a new editor instance at the end of a specific DOM element. ...

members.name: domReady
members.doc:
Specify a function to execute when the DOM is fully loaded.

If called after the DOM has been initialized, the function passed in will be executed immediately.

@todo
members.short_doc: Specify a function to execute when the DOM is fully loaded. ...

members.name: editorConfig
members.doc:
Function called upon loading a custom configuration file that can modify the editor instance configuration (CKEDITOR.editor.config). It is usually defined inside the custom configuration files that can include developer defined settings.

// This is supposed to be placed in the config.js file.
CKEDITOR.editorConfig = function( config ) {
    // Define changes to default configuration here. For example:
    config.language = 'fr';
    config.uiColor = '#AADC6E';
};

params.name: config
params.doc: A configuration object containing the settings defined for a CKEDITOR.editor instance up to this function call. Note that not all settings may still be available. See Configuration Loading Order for details.

members.short_doc:
Function called upon loading a custom configuration file that can
modify the editor instance configuration (CKEDITOR....

members.name: getCss
members.doc: Returns a string will all CSS rules passed to the addCss method.
members.short_doc: Returns a string will all CSS rules passed to the addCss method. ...

members.name: getTemplate
members.doc: Retrieves a defined template created with addTemplate.

params.name: name
params.doc: The template name.

members.short_doc: Retrieves a defined template created with addTemplate. ...

members.name: getUrl
members.doc:
Gets the full URL for CKEditor resources. By default, URLs returned by this function contain a querystring parameter ("t") set to the timestamp value.

It is possible to provide a custom implementation of this function by setting a global variable named CKEDITOR_GETURL. This global variable must be set before the editor script loading. If the custom implementation returns nothing (==null), the default implementation is used.

// e.g. 'http://www.example.com/ckeditor/skins/default/editor.css?t=87dm'
alert( CKEDITOR.getUrl( 'skins/default/editor.css' ) );

// e.g. 'http://www.example.com/skins/default/editor.css?t=87dm'
alert( CKEDITOR.getUrl( '/skins/default/editor.css' ) );

// e.g. 'http://www.somesite.com/skins/default/editor.css?t=87dm'
alert( CKEDITOR.getUrl( 'http://www.somesite.com/skins/default/editor.css' ) );

params.name: resource
params.doc: The resource whose full URL we want to get. It may be a full, absolute, or relative URL.

members.short_doc: Gets the full URL for CKEditor resources. ...

members.name: inline
members.doc:
Turns a DOM element with contenteditable attribute set to true into a CKEditor instance. Check CKEDITOR.dtd.$editable for the list of allowed element names.

<div contenteditable="true" id="content">...</div>
...
CKEDITOR.inline( 'content' );

It is also possible to create an inline editor from the <textarea> element. If you do so, an additional <div> element with editable content will be created directly after the <textarea> element and the <textarea> element will be hidden.

params.name: element
params.doc: The DOM element or its ID.

params.name: instanceConfig
params.doc: The specific configurations to apply to this editor instance. See CKEDITOR.config.

members.short_doc:
Turns a DOM element with contenteditable attribute set to true into a
CKEditor instance. ...

members.name: inlineAll
members.doc: Calls inline for all page elements with contenteditable attribute set to true.
members.short_doc:
Calls inline for all page elements with
contenteditable attribute set to true. ...

members.name: loadFullCore
members.doc:
Forces the full CKEditor core code, in the case only the basic code has been loaded (ckeditor_basic.js). This method self-destroys (becomes undefined) in the first call or as soon as the full code is available.

// Check if the full core code has been loaded and load it.
if ( CKEDITOR.loadFullCore )
    CKEDITOR.loadFullCore();
members.short_doc:
Forces the full CKEditor core code, in the case only the basic code has been
loaded (ckeditor_basic.js). ...

members.name: remove
members.doc: Removes an editor instance from the global CKEDITOR object. This function is available for internal use only. External code must use CKEDITOR.editor.destroy.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to be removed.

members.short_doc: Removes an editor instance from the global CKEDITOR object. ...

members.name: replace
members.doc:
Replaces a <textarea> or a DOM element (<div>) with a CKEditor instance. For textareas, the initial value in the editor will be the textarea value. For DOM elements, their innerHTML will be used instead. We recommend using <textarea> and <div> elements only.

<textarea id="myfield" name="myfield"></textarea>
...
CKEDITOR.replace( 'myfield' );

var textarea = document.body.appendChild( document.createElement( 'textarea' ) );
CKEDITOR.replace( textarea );

params.name: element
params.doc: The DOM element (textarea), its ID, or name.

params.name: config
params.doc: The specific configuration to apply to this editor instance. Configuration set here will override the global CKEditor settings (see CKEDITOR.config).

members.short_doc:
Replaces a <textarea> or a DOM element (<div>) with a CKEditor
instance. ...

members.name: replaceAll
members.doc:
Replaces all <textarea> elements available in the document with editor instances.

// Replace all <textarea> elements in the page.
CKEDITOR.replaceAll();

// Replace all <textarea class="myClassName"> elements in the page.
CKEDITOR.replaceAll( 'myClassName' );

// Selectively replace <textarea> elements, based on custom assertions.
CKEDITOR.replaceAll( function( textarea, config ) {
    // An assertion function that needs to be evaluated for the <textarea>
    // to be replaced. It must explicitely return "false" to ignore a
    // specific <textarea>.
    // You can also customize the editor instance by having the function
    // modify the "config" parameter.
} );

params.name: className
params.doc: The <textarea> class name.

params.name: function
params.doc: An assertion function that must return true for a <textarea> to be replaced with the editor. If the function returns false, the <textarea> element will not be replaced.

members.short_doc:
Replaces all <textarea> elements available in the document with
editor instances. ...

members.name: ariaWidget
members.doc: Fired when a panel is added to the document.

params.name: data
params.doc: The element wrapping the panel.

members.short_doc: Fired when a panel is added to the document. ...

members.name: contentPreview
members.doc: Event fired when executing preview command, which allows additional data manipulation. With this event, the raw HTML content of the preview window to be displayed can be altered or modified.

params.name: editor
params.doc: This editor instance.

params.name: data

properties.name: dataValue
properties.doc: The data that will go to the preview.

members.short_doc: Event fired when executing preview command, which allows additional data manipulation. ...

members.name: currentInstance
members.doc:
Fired when the CKEDITOR.currentInstance object reference changes. This may happen when setting the focus on different editor instances in the page.

var editor; // A variable to store a reference to the current editor.
CKEDITOR.on( 'currentInstance', function() {
    editor = CKEDITOR.currentInstance;
} );
members.short_doc: Fired when the CKEDITOR.currentInstance object reference changes. ...

members.name: dialogDefinition
members.doc:
Fired when a dialog definition is about to be used to create a dialog into an editor instance. This event makes it possible to customize the definition before creating it.

Note that this event is called only the first time a specific dialog is opened. Successive openings will use the cached dialog, and this event will not get fired.

params.name: data
params.doc: The dialog defination that is being loaded.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance that will use the dialog.

members.short_doc:
Fired when a dialog definition is about to be used to create a dialog into
an editor instance. ...

members.name: instanceCreated
members.doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is created, but still before initializing it. To interact with a fully initialized instance, use the instanceReady event instead.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance that has been created.

members.short_doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is created, but still before initializing it. ...

members.name: instanceDestroyed
members.doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is destroyed.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance that has been destroyed.

members.short_doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is destroyed. ...

members.name: instanceLoaded
members.doc: Fired when CKEDITOR instance's components (config, languages and plugins) are fully loaded and initialized. However, the editor will be fully ready to for interaction on instanceReady.

params.name: editor
params.doc: This editor instance that has been loaded.

members.short_doc:
Fired when CKEDITOR instance's components (config, languages and plugins) are fully
loaded and initialized. ...

members.name: instanceReady
members.doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is created, fully initialized and ready for interaction.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance that has been created.

members.short_doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR instance is created, fully initialized and ready for interaction. ...

members.name: loaded
members.doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR core object is fully loaded and ready for interaction.
members.short_doc: Fired when a CKEDITOR core object is fully loaded and ready for interaction. ...

members.name: reset
members.doc: Fired when the last instance has been destroyed. This event is used to perform global memory cleanup.
members.short_doc: Fired when the last instance has been destroyed. ...

short_doc: This is the API entry point. ...
